turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Permo-Carboniferous.
turn.1: What is the meaning of Permo-Carboniferous?
turn.2: Permo-Carboniferous The Permo-Carboniferous refers to the time period including the latter parts of the Carboniferous and early part of the Permian period.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Permo-Carboniferous rocks are in places not differentiated because of the presence of transitional fossils, and also where no conspicuous stratigraphic break is present.
turn.5: What happened in the Permo-Carboniferous period?
turn.6: Permo-Carboniferous time, about 300 million years ago, was a period of significant glaciation.
turn.7: What are the significances of Glaciation?
turn.8: The widespread distribution of Permo-Carboniferous glacial sediments in South America, Africa, Madagascar, Arabia, India, Antarctica and Australia was one of the major pieces of evidence for the theory of continental drift, and led ultimately to the concept of a super-continent, Pangaea.
turn.9: Was there any other piece of evidence that continental drift happened?
turn.10: Glacial activity spanned virtually the whole of Carboniferous and Early Permian time.
turn.11: Did anything else happen in that period?
turn.12: Toward the end of the Carboniferous, around 290 million years ago, Gondwana, the southern part of Pangaea, was located near the south pole.
